articleContent.title: Arpeggio: 13th in A# (Shape: A)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: 13th in A# (Shape: A)

## Brief Description:
The A# major 13th arpeggio, commonly played in the shape of A major, consists of the notes A#, C##, E##, G##, B#, D##, and F##. As the name suggests, it includes the root note (A#), major 3rd (C##), perfect 5th (E##), dominant 7th (G##), major 9th (B#), perfect 11th (D##), and major 13th (F##), creating a lush and complex sound.

## Notes and Intervals:
- A# (Root)
- C## (Major 3rd)
- E## (Perfect 5th)
- G## (Dominant 7th)
- B# (Major 9th)
- D## (Perfect 11th)
- F## (Major 13th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor:
This arpeggio is often used in jazz, funk, and fusion music due to its rich and colorful tonality. It adds a sophisticated and jazzy flavor to compositions and improvisations. The A# major 13th arpeggio can evoke feelings of elegance, sophistication, and harmonic complexity when used in a musical context.

## Songs:
1. **"Cantaloupe Island" by Herbie Hancock**: This jazz standard features complex harmonies where the A# major 13th arpeggio could be employed in improvisational sections.
   
2. **"Come On, Come Over" by Jaco Pastorius**: This funk tune showcases groovy bass lines that could incorporate the A# major 13th arpeggio for added flavor.

3. **"Birdland" by Weather Report**: A fusion masterpiece that blends intricate harmonies and energetic rhythms; utilizing the A# major 13th arpeggio could enhance the harmonic depth in solos or arrangements.
